newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times business - July 22.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times business - July 22.

text.p: The New York Times reported the following business stories Tuesday:
* As aircraft giant Boeing branches out by selling corporate jets and training pilots, it is staying close to its roots.
* IBM reported second quarter earnings that were better than expected.

* A merger involving the two biggest banks in Bavaria, Bayerische Vereinsbank A.G. and Bayerische Hypotheken und Wechsel Bank, is the most dramatic move so far by European banks to shore up their strength to compete in an increasingly borderless economy.

* A series of 1994 transactions between the Columbia/HCA Healthcare Corp and the manager of home health agencies in Florida is an important part of the unfolding criminal investigation of the giant hospital company.
* AT&T reported a 38 percent plunge in second quarter income from continuing operations.
* The Dow gained 16.26 points but broader market averages were lower.
* The proposed merger between First Union and Signet Banking sent Signet shares soaring.
* Exxon said its earnings rose 25 percent for the second quarter.
* Texas Pacific agreed to buy Zilog for $527 million.
* Sprint agreed to buy Paranet for $425 million.
* Currency speculation continued to take a toll on South and Southeast Asian economies.
* Microsoft made a minority investment in Progressive Networks to help that company develop technology for audio and video broadcasts over the Internet.

* As the white-hot premium cigar industry enters a shakeout period, H. Upmann, Consolidated Cigar 's flagship premium cigar, is starting a multi-million-dollar ad campaign to ensure it emerges as a winner.
